Judul: INNOVATIVE FINANCING SCHEME USING STRUCTURED LONGER PAYMENT TERM
Abstrak: The application of Law No. 36 year 1999 on Telecommunications, which implied the spirit of anti-monopoly in the Indonesian telecommunication business, has triggered a very rapid growth in the domestic telecommunication industry. The emerging of many new players in telecommunication industry have created the very tight competition that turns into price war; and consequently, causes ARPU (Average Revenue per User) to fall down. In such condition, telecom operators are required to improve their service qualities and network coverage. These conditions are certainly difficult for the telecom operators, because as ARPU falls, they are required to make huge investment to improve their service qualities and network coverage. In delivering this, the telecom operators need a long-term payment scheme that allows investment to be realized because they are experiencing near term cash flow shortages. PT. XYZ Indonesia is one of the telecommunication vendors that specializes in the telecommunication facilities instalation projects. PT. XYZ has many experiences in doing major telecommunication projects. The internal conditon that showed in the financial aspects is good. One of the projects to be handled is the telecommunication network development project in Sumatra that needs longer term repayment model for this project. Two (2) financing models evaluated, the model chosen is WB/GEF Loan Guarantee Program. This model can provide benefits for both parties, PT. XYZ and the target customer. Some of the risks that may arise have been recognized and analyzed with mitigation plan proposed to reduce those risks. The methodology for this research use is the kind of market research with qualitative method, where the case is network telecommunication building in Sumatera Island project. Types of data that collected in this research is secondary data, such the company profile data, company financial data, project data that handled by PT. XYZ Indonesia and telecommunication network building project in Sumatra Island project data, also the market research based on data that available in the public such in the internet and from the newspaper.
